newsitem.title: USA: USWC spot products fall after strike threat ends.
newsitem.headline: USWC spot products fall after strike threat ends.

text.p: U.S. West Coast spot product prices fell Monday after Tosco averted a potential refinery strike and an early morning fire was contained quickly at a small California refinery, traders said.
A Tosco official on Saturday said union workers and the company reach a labor contract agreement that ends the chance of strike at four California refineries.
Traders shrugged off an early morning fire at Paramount Petroleum's Los Angeles refinery, saying the facility's production was too small to threaten supply.
"Even if it burned the place down, it would have no effect," one broker said.
Adequate supply had traders forecasting a soft market, with more production coming from Exxon and Mobil's refineries following their return from spring maintenance.
There was little buying interest for CARB unleaded gasoline in Los Angeles.
Sellers talked CARB in L.A. at 84 cents gallon, down two cents from late Thursday spot trade.

CARB diesel, which was active last week, rose 0.50 early Monday amid trader talk of a blending problem ARCO's Carson, plant. "We saw them buying last week," one broker said, adding they had since dropped out.
